chargeHist.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael D Sanders was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.075(1r).
  • Child Enticement-Sexual Contact, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Bond will be applied, any remaining unpaid balance will run concurrently with the sentence.
Apply bond and any remaining unpaid balance will be run concurrently with his sentence.

Sex offender treatment. Register as a sex-offender. 
Full-time employment or job searches of 5 per week.  
Agent control for internet devices.  Agent approval needed for contact with female minors.  
Any counseling agent deems appropriate. 
Cannot live within 1,000 feet of a daycare, school or park.  
Provide a DNA sample.

records.addlTxt: Exhibit #2 Extraction Report
Exhibit #1 Magnet Forensics

Defendant Michael D Sanders in court with attorney Bradley J Jansen.  Defendant Michael D Sanders in custody.  Gregory A. Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Detective CG called by the state:  sworn in and testifies.  Exhibit #1 Forensics Case Info marked, identified and admitted.  Exhibit #2 : Extraction report marked, identified and admitted. Detective answers questions from Attorney Parker and reads from the exhibits.  Questioned about the exhibits by Attorney Jansen.  
Attorneys make their sentence recommendations.  Sentenced as follows:  
5 years I/C and 5 years ES on count 1 and 2 years IC and 5 years ES on Count 2 concurrent.  
Sex offender treatment.  Full-time employment or job searches of 5 per week.  Register as Sex offender.  Agent control for internet devices.  Any counseling agent deems appropriate.  Cannot live within 1,000 feet of a daycare, school or park.  Agent approval needed for contact with female minors.  Provide a DNA sample.
Does not qualify for CIP or SAP.  
544 days credit

document doesn't indicate whether the State public defender will represent for the purpose of appeal or not....but Attorney Jansen was appointed by Public defender so I sent the information to the State Pubic Defender office in Madison.

partial transcript of motion hearing held March 5, 2018

Defendant Michael D Sanders in court with attorney Bradley J Jansen.  Defendant Michael D Sanders in custody.  Gregory A. Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to both counts.  Court advises party of their rights, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and finds guilty.  Citizenship, voting, and/or firearms information provided.  Recommendations made:  Class C - 5 years confinement, Class D - 2 years confinement concurrent, Class H - 1 year jail concurrent. Free to argue ES time frames and recommendations.  DA has agreed not to charge any additional bailjumpings, potential child porn or federal referral arising from this incident.  Bond continued.  Defendant does not want a PSI conducted.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 29, 2018 at 02:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on March 29, 2018 at 02:30 pm.

#1 - excerpts from text messages
#2 - operational and investigative standards
#3 - Report Dr. Cummings
#4 - CV of Dr. Anna Salter
#5 - Website info

Defendant Michael D Sanders in court with attorney Bradley J Jansen.  Defendant Michael D Sanders in custody.  Gregory A. Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion to dismiss argued by Attny Jansen. Submits Exhibits 1 - excerpts from text messages and Exhibit #2 - operational and investigative standards.  DA indicates Special Agent Joy will testify by phone as to the standards used by internet crimes task force.  Court swears in Agent Joy who is questioned by the DA.  Cross exam by Attny Jansen.  No specific State standards, rely on federal standards.  Court questions witness.  Motion to dismiss for not producing discovery.  Court does not believe that any harm occurred.  Dr. Frank Cummings sworn and testifies, stipulates to qualification.  Questioned about psycho sexual evaluation.   Exhibit #3 - Report of Dr. Cummings marked, identified, offered and received (to be sealed).  Cross exam by Attny Parker.  Objections - Court requests clarification.  Cross. Objection - speculation.  Re-direct.  Court questions witness.  Witness excused.  Recess at 4:35-4:40 p.m.  Exhibit #4 - CV of Dr. Carol Salter marked, offered and received.  Dr. Carol Salter sworn and testifies for the State.  Cross by Attny Jansen.  Witness excused.  Arguments.  Court will not allow testimony of either doctor at trial.  Court will not allow Exhibit #2 used at trial.  Exhibit #5 - steps to website, marked offered and received.  Court will allow this exhibit at trial.  Subpoena of Chelsea was returned, defense will serve at trial (state's witness).  Discovery pages 242-252 provided to defense.  Arguments as to usage of phone calls.  Court will allow whatever State intends on providing as evidence.

Transcript of Motion Hearing, September 8, 2017

Defendant Michael D Sanders in court with attorney Bradley J Jansen.  Gregory A. Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Discussions about defense witness list.  Atty Jansen thought it was submitted back in June.  Inadvertently missed.  Submitted now, today.  Exhibit #1 marked.  Presented by Atty Parker.  
Atty Jansen wants Doctor to testify to make 3 points:  lack of sexual interests, doesn't possess psychopatic traits and gave honest answers 
Atty Parker feels he was sandbagged; no jury packet on this, not prepared.  Atty Jansen confused and states how is this any different than what he filed in his motion?  
State requests an expert if this is going to be allowed.  Judge reviews entrapment jury instructions, basics reviewed.  Logically--experts may be needed.  DA Parker request Offer of Proof, request copy of CD that Atty Jansen received this morning from doctor.  
Summary needed to present to state so they can present to an expert.  Summary is due next Friday 9-15 at noon.  Status conference scheduled for October 4, 2017 at 11:00 am.

#1 - Consent to give statement.
#2 - DVD of interview of defendant.

Attny Jansen's subpoena was returned on K. Stone.  DA indicates she will be here for trial,  Attny Jansen states will serve her the day of trial if in fact she shows.. If witness doesn't appear, there will be issues regarding ability to confront a witness.  Goodchild Hearing requested and held.  Jesse S. sworn and testifies.  Exh. #1-consent to give statement, marked, offered and received.  Exh. #2 DVD marked, shown to Court and defense.  Parties agree Miranda-Goodchild was complied with.  Prior record of defendant discussed - No priors.  Further motions in limine gone through one at a time.  Gordon K. sworn & testified regarding his communications with the defendant.  Cross exam.  Court will not allow defense to question height and weight of person depicted in the photo's sent to the defendant.  Other motions in limine discussed.  Witnesses will be sequestered.  Addt'l discovery Pages 175-241 need to be provided.  Defendant has no prior record.  A psycho-sexual report was completed.  DA has offered an amendment to the charge.  DA will file Daubert Motion and attempt hearing before jury trial next week.
